Dr. Allyse Leigh Weltman and Dr. Michael Stuart Caplan, both medical residents in Washington, are to be married today by Rabbi Lester Polonsky at the Milleridge Cottage, a caterer in Jericho, N.Y.

The bride, 29, is a resident in obstetrics and gynecology at George Washington University Hospital; the bridegroom, 28, is a pediatrics resident at Children's National Medical Center. They graduated from the State University at Binghamton, N.Y., she cum laude, and received master's degrees in medical sciences from Boston University.

Dr. Weltman, who will keep her name, received her medical degree from the University of Vermont. Her father, William Weltman of Great Neck, N.Y., is a salesman at the Lord & Taylor store in Manhasset, N.Y. Her mother, Susan Weltman of Bayside, Queens, teaches prekindergarten classes at Public School 220 in Forest Hills, Queens.

Dr. Caplan received his medical degree from Boston University. He is a son of Phyllis and Ross Caplan of Baldwin, N.Y. His mother is the administrative assistant at the nursery school at Temple Beth-El in Bellmore, N.Y. His father retired from the KeySpan Corporation, a utility holding company in Hicksville, N.Y., where he was the manager responsible for contracts and federal regulations.
